attributes.action: Explain why the mileage allowance is still 40p per mile - since 2003
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Since 2003, fuel prices have escalated dramatically - all to the benefit of the Exchequer.  During that time the claimable mileage allowance has remained static at 40p per mile.

Could the PM explain why this is deemed to be fair and reasonable, or just another opportunistic stealth tax grab?

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
